admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
Impressive ratings convey a highly
            satisfactory project outcome, highly likely sustainability,
            and substantial institutional development impacts,
            accompanied by highly satisfactory performances by both the
            Bank, and Borrower. The success of this operation, thus
            provide important lessons. The experience reinforces project
            design as paramount in addressing the most critical road
            sector needs, and its sustainability, with a project concept
            kept simple and manageable. Lessons drawn from previous
            projects were applied during project preparation, and
            include: up-front technical assistance to supplement and
            enhance borrower's capacity; careful planning and
            review of the civil works final design, and budgeting; and,
            a manageable scale of investments. The preparation of the
            project transferred technical knowledge to Lao counterparts,
            facilitating its successful implementation. The project was
            completed within the planned time and budget. Strong and
            committed leadership proved essential in achieving outcomes,
            which given the project inherited a committed, competent and
            experienced leadership, helped with trouble-shooting
            throughout the implementation period, and, promoted the
            development of local contractors, and strengthened
            government institutions in procurement, and contract
            management. Mainstreaming project implementation into the
            Ministry of Communication, Transport, Post and Construction
            proved beneficial, through the creation of the Project
            Monitoring Division, consolidating all coordination units,
            supported by donors in the road sector. It succeeded in
            integrating all functions including, project monitoring and
            reporting, donor coordination and staff professional
            development. Other lessons address the effectiveness of
            technical audits, as instruments for enhancing quality, and,
            the success of gradual introduction of competitive bidding practices.
